node.title: Police believe Margaret River fire was 'deliberately lit' as threat level downgraded
node.alt: Firefighters stand on the ledge of a lookout overlooking the entrance to a cave
node.description: Police are appealing for information after confirming a fire that ripped through Western Australia's world-famous wine and surfing region was deliberately lit.
node.content:
["Police are appealing for information after confirming the fire that\u00a0ripped through Western Australia's premier tourism region was deliberately lit.\u00a0", "It comes after the\u00a0threat level of the inferno that tore through the Margaret River region's unique forest\u00a0was downgraded to a watch and act.\u00a0", "Detectives from Strike Force Vulcan, WA's bushfire and arson unit, have put a call out for information from the public about the fire, which was ignited on Wednesday.\u00a0", "\"Based on an initial assessment of the fire scene, it is believed the fire was deliberately lit, and may have been ignited near Mammoth Cave,\" police said in a statement.\u00a0", "", "
Police believe the fire started near Mammoth Cave, before it quickly spread through Boranup Forest.\u00a0(Supplied: Sean Blocksidge)
", "The cave is accessed via Caves Road and is near the border of the Boranup and Forest Grove suburbs.\u00a0", "Police would like to hear from anyone who saw any suspicious activity around the cave last Wednesday, or anyone with dash-cam or mobile phone vision of people or vehicles in the area on that day.\u00a0", "Anyone with information can call Crime Stoppers or upload vision here.\u00a0", "Authorities will today continue to assess the trail of destruction left by the fire, which destroyed about 8,000 hectares.", "", "
Locals are upset over the devastating impact of the fire on the forest.(Supplied: Wallcliffe Volunteer fire brigade)
", "The cooler weather and favourable wind conditions helped firefighters gain the upper hand yesterday after battling the blaze for three days.\u00a0", "Incident Controller Brad Barton said this helped firefighters save tourist attractions including the Conto's campsite and the Mammoth and Lakes caves.\u00a0", "\"Unfortunately, there's been some impacts on some of the infrastructure around the caves,\" he said.", "\"There will be some very high impacted areas obviously as it was a very intensive fire.\"", "He said firefighters and volunteers had done an \"amazing job\".\u00a0", "While he said people should stay away from fire-affected areas, he encouraged people to keep their holiday plans in the area.\u00a0", "", "
Firefighters managed to save\u00a0Conto's campground, where tents were left abandoned as the blaze\u00a0came through.\u00a0(ABC News: Anthony Pancia)
", "Deputy Incident Controller Craig Garrett said crews would begin\u00a0assessing the damage, and would work\u00a0with stakeholders and the local council\u00a0to prepare a report on the impact.", "\"There's a lot of work to be done in the park so it could take a number of weeks to look at the damage,\" he said.\u00a0", "The watch and act warning remains in place for people bounded\u00a0by Calgardup Brook to the north, Caves Road to the Leeuwin-Naturaliste National Park boundary to the north and east, Hamelin Bay Road West and the park boundary to the south and the coastline to the west.", "While the fire is controlled and\u00a0no longer on the move, it is not controlled.\u00a0"]
